name: Avoid Include Circular references
description: This reports show all the ABAP includes that are part of a circular reference.
output:
Associated to each ABAP Include with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The level of inclusion
rationale: Includes should not have circular references. Circular references between Include files can lead to problems compiling a Program or even the complete inability to do so.
remediation: The best answer to this problem is to reconsider the architecture of the program. Sometimes you can use forward declarations to avoid circular references.
